high.description: Consolidated Profit and Loss Account reports 2019 Turnover as US$11,601,937, which does not tie to Note 3 Segment Information reporting US$11,413,312. This overstatement creates cascading errors in Gross Profit calculations.

The P&L 'Gross loss' line is mathematically incorrect (Turnover 11,413,312 - Cost 10,221,721 = 1,191,591; stated as 1,241,591). It is also incorrectly labeled 'Gross loss' despite being a positive profit figure.

Balance Sheet reports Intangible Assets of 2,373,252, which does not tie to the detailed Note 11 closing balance of 2,298,948. This discrepancy causes the 'Total non-current assets' subtotal (2,940,021) to not cross-foot with its components.

Balance Sheet 'Reserves' (1,170,520) plus 'Share Capital' (13,686) equals 1,184,206, which does not match the reported 'Shareholders' Funds' subtotal of 1,264,206. The Reserves value fails to tie to the Statement of Changes in Equity (1,250,520).

Consolidated Cash Flow Statement reports 'Net cash generated from operations' as 327,617, which mismatches the Note 31(a) reconciliation of 317,102. Consequently, the subtotal 'Net cash outflow from operating activities' (280,854) does not cross-foot on the statement face.
Note 3 reports Supply Chain Solutions turnover as an erroneous 88,344,820 (should be 8,834,482). This causes the segment total (9,999,701) to fail cross-footing.
Note 8 lists the interim dividend paid as 15,962, but the total for the year is 10,962. Other statements confirm the correct value is 10,962, making 15,962 a typo.

Note 30 Deferred Tax rollforward contains errors in the opening balance (13,591 vs 13,951 restated closing) and exchange differences sign, causing the vertical calculation to not foot to the ending balance.

Note 28 Long-term Liabilities maturity components (Within 1 year: 516,798) do not match the sum of current portions (491,798), and the table components sum to 1,563,851 which does not match the reported subtotal of 1,538,851.

medium.description: Total Margin (1,219,336) does not equal Gross Profit + Other Income (1,269,336). Note: Total Margin matches the Segment Note, suggesting the Gross Profit figure derived from the erroneous P&L turnover is the root cause.
Note 22 presents the positive cash balance of 932,167 in parentheses '(932,167)', incorrectly implying a liability/overdraft.
Opening cash balance breakdown component (612,931) does not sum to the total (612,391) or tie to the closing 2018 balance.
Note 19 Related Party trade amount aging sums to 545,669, which mismatches the total trade amount of 539,933 reported in the main note.
Interest rate sensitivity analysis implies a variable debt principal (~869M) significantly larger than the total bank borrowings (~305M) disclosed in Note 24.
Columnar summation of Retained Earnings in SOCE 2019 (Opening + Profit + OCI + Transations) results in 444,483, mismatching the closing balance of 443,582.
Sum of transactions in 2018 Other Reserves column (-451,002) does not match subtotal (-501,243).

low.description: Headers for 2019 columns in P&L and Segment Note 3 incorrectly labeled 'HK$000' instead of 'US$000'.
Consolidated P&L title incorrectly states 'For the year ended 31 December 2018' instead of 2019.
Note 21 title is 'Trade and Other Payables', but content refers to Trade and Other Receivables.
Auditor remuneration expense is presented in brackets (4,511), inconsistent with previous year presentation and its nature as an expense in that context.
Detailed non-current assets section on Balance Sheet is labeled 'Non-current liabilities'.
Note referencing HKFRS 16 impact labels table 'As at 1 January 2019' but presents 1 January 2018 data.

raw_findings.description: Line 'Net cash generated from operations' reported as 327,617 does not match reconciliation in Note 31(a) which shows 317,102. Consequently, the subtotal 'Net cash outflow from operating activities' (280,854) does not equal the sum of its components using the reported value (280,854 != 327,617 - 1,129 - 35,119 = 291,369), but it does work using the Note 31(a) value.
Consolidated Profit and Loss Account title incorrectly states 'For the year ended 31 December 2018' while reporting data for the year 2019.

Continuing Operations Turnover reported as 11,601,937 does not match the sum of segment turnover in Note 3 (11,413,312). Additionally, the column unit header 'HK$000' is likely a mislabeling as the figures correspond better to US$ values used throughout the report.

Subtotal 'Gross loss' reported as 1,241,591 is incorrect both in label (should be profit) and calculation (11,601,937 - 10,221,721 = 1,380,216). Even using correct Turnover from Note 3, calculation would be 11,413,312 - 10,221,721 = 1,191,591.
Line item 'Gross loss' for both 2019 and 2018 columns should be labeled 'Gross profit' as the subtraction of cost of sales from turnover results in positive values.

Supply Chain Solutions turnover reported as 88,344,820 does not sum to the segment total of 9,999,701 (88,344,820 + 1,173,277 - 8,058 = 89,510,039). The figure likely contains a typo and should be 8,834,482.
Intangible assets for 2019 on Balance Sheet (2,373,252) does not tie to Note 11 (2,298,948) or the Ten-Year Financial Summary (2,298,948).

Cash and cash equivalents for Continuing Operations at 1 January 2019 reported as 612,931 does not match the 2018 closing balance of 612,391 found on the Balance Sheet and in Note 22. It also does not sum to the 'Total' column value of 612,391 shown on the same page.
Logistics services income reported as 1,152,363 does not match Note 3 sub-table analysis on page 151 which shows 1,173,277. Similarly, SCS turnover breakdown is inconsistent with segment data.

In the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account for 2019, the subtotal for Gross profit is shown as 1,241,591. However, subtracting Cost of sales (10,221,721) from Turnover (11,413,312) results in 1,191,591. Other income (27,745) is correctly added to 1,191,591 to reach Total margin of 1,219,336, confirming the subtotal displayed is mathematically incorrect.

In Note 8, the table for dividends shows an interim dividend for 2019 of 15,962, with a total for the year of 10,962. A total cannot be less than its components. Based on the dividend per share and other statements, the interim value should be 10,962.

In Note 3 Supplementary analysis, the turnover for Supply Chain Solutions is listed as 88,344,820 in HK$ thousands. However, when summed with Logistics Services (1,173,277) and less Eliminations (8,058), it does not cross-foot to the shown total of 9,999,701 (which is consistent with the US$ value). The correct value should be 8,834,482.

The Consolidated Balance Sheet shows Intangible assets of 2,373,252 at 31 December 2019. However, the breakdown provided in Note 11 (Intangible Assets) sums to 2,298,948. Additionally, Note 11 specifies 'Closing net book amount' for 2019 as 2,298,948.

In the Consolidated Balance Sheet at 31 December 2019, the 'Reserves' line item is shown as 1,170,520. When added to 'Share capital' of 13,686, the sum is 1,184,206, which does not match the 'Shareholders’ funds attributable to the Company’s Shareholders' subtotal of 1,264,206. Based on the SOCE, the correct value for total reserves (including premium and retained earnings) is 1,250,520.

In the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement for 2019, 'Net cash generated from operations' is shown as 327,617. However, the reconciliation provided in Note 31(a) correctly sums to 317,102. Furthermore, the Cash Flow Statement subtotal 'Net cash outflow from operating activities' of 280,854 calculation only works if the top line is 317,102 (317,102 - 1,129 - 35,119 = 280,854).

In Note 22 (Cash and Cash Equivalents), the balance for 2019 is presented as (932,167) in brackets. This notation typically represents a negative balance or a liability. However, the Consolidated Balance Sheet correctly presents this as a debit asset of 932,167.

2019 Gross Profit should be US$1,191,591 (Turnover 11,413,312 - Cost of sales 10,221,721). Document shows US$1,241,591. Note: Calculation assumes Turnover from Note 3 should be used, but Statement also has Turnover mismatch. Using printed Turnover 11,601,937 - 10,221,721 = 1,380,216 which also mismatches.
2019 Turnover on Consolidated Profit and Loss Account is US$11,601,937 but in Segment Information Note 3 (p. 175) it is US$11,413,312.
2019 Intangible Assets on Balance Sheet is US$2,373,252 but in Note 11 (p. 180) the closing net book amount is US$2,298,948.
2019 Shareholders' funds attributable to the Company's Shareholders (US$1,264,206) does not equal the sum of its components: Share capital (US$13,686) + Reserves (US$1,170,520) = US$1,184,206.
2019 'Net cash generated from operations' on Consolidated Cash Flow Statement is US$327,617 but in the Note 31(a) reconciliation (p. 211) it is US$317,102.

2019 'Net cash inflow from operating activities' US$280,854 does not sum from its components: 327,617 - 1,129 - 35,119 = 291,369. (Mismatch is US$10,515, which is the same discrepancy found in the link to Note 31a).

2019 Maturity of financial liabilities total (US$1,593,391) does not sum from its components: 516,798 + 314,079 + 732,974 + 54,540 = 1,618,391. (The component 'Within 1 year' of 516,798 is US$25,000 higher than the current portion on the BS).
2019 Opening Deferred Taxation balance (Net Asset) is US$13,591 but the 2018 closing balance was restated to US$13,951. Consequently, the rollforward to US$24,953 also fails to foot using components.
Note 21 is incorrectly titled 'Trade and Other Payables'. It should be 'Trade and Other Receivables' based on its content and Note 23.

Intangible assets value on Balance Sheet (2,373,252) does not tie to Note 11 Intangible Assets closing balance (2,298,948). Furthermore, only the Note balance allows the Non-current assets subtotal (2,940,021) to foot correctly.

On p. 112, the 'Shareholders’ funds attributable to the Company’s Shareholders' subtotal for 2019 (1,264,206) does not foot from its components: Share capital (13,686) + Reserves (1,170,520) = 1,184,206. Based on the SOCIE (p. 148), the correct Reserves value should be 1,250,520.
On the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (p. 143), the 'Total margin' (1,219,336) does not foot from its components: Gross profit (1,241,591) + Other income (27,745) = 1,269,336.
Turnover on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (11,601,937) does not tie to Note 3 Segment Information (11,413,312) or the Ten-Year Financial Summary (11,413,312).

In Note 8 Dividends, the interim dividend paid for 2019 is listed as 15,962. However, the Consolidated Statement of Changes in Equity (p. 148) and the report text (p. 124) state the interim dividend was 10,962 (approx. US$11 million).

In Note 28 Long-term Liabilities, the 'Within 1 year' maturity bucket for 2019 is listed as 516,798. The sum of underlying current portions from Note 28 details (Notes: 374,361 + Lease: 117,437) is only 491,798. Additionally, the bucket sum (516,798 + 314,079 + 732,974 = 1,563,851) fails to foot to the 'Wholly repayable within 5 years' subtotal (1,538,851), whereas using the component sum (491,798) would make the table foot correctly.

In Note 31(a) Reconciliation of Profit Before Taxation to Net Cash Generated from Operations, the final total 'Net cash generated from operations' for 2019 is 317,102. This does not tie to the corresponding line in the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement (p. 150) which shows 327,617.

On p. 177, the 2019 column of the supplementary analysis for the Services segment is incorrectly labeled 'HK$'000'. Based on Segment Note 3 (p. 175) and other disclosures, the values on this page are presented in US$'000'.

On the Consolidated Balance Sheet (page 147), the sum of Share capital (13,686) and Reserves (1,170,520) is 1,184,206, but the reported subtotal for 'Shareholders funds attributable to the Companys Shareholders' is 1,264,206. This indicates a cross-footing error of 80,000.

Reserves on the Consolidated Balance Sheet (page 147) are reported as 1,170,520. However, the sum of Share premium (760,754), Other reserves (46,184), and Retained earnings (443,582) from the Consolidated Statement of Changes in Equity (page 148) is 1,250,520. The discrepancy is 80,000.
Intangible assets on the Consolidated Balance Sheet (page 146) are reported as 2,373,252. However, Note 11 (page 184) reports total Intangible Assets of 2,298,948. The discrepancy is 74,304.

On the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (page 143), Gross profit (1,241,591) plus Other income (27,745) equals 1,269,336, but the 'Total margin' is reported as 1,219,336. This is a cross-footing error of 50,000.
On the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (page 143), Turnover (11,601,937) minus Cost of sales (10,221,721) equals 1,380,216. However, the statement shows 1,241,591 as the Gross Profit subtotal.
Turnover on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (page 143) is reported as 11,601,937. However, Note 3 Segment Information (page 175) reports total Turnover of 11,413,312. The values do not tie.

In Note 3 Segment Information (page 151/177), the turnover for Supply Chain Solutions is reported as 88,344,820. Summing this with Logistics Services (1,173,277) and subtracting Eliminations (8,058) results in 89,510,039, whereas the reported total for the Services segment is 9,999,701. The value 88,344,820 appears to be a typo for 8,834,482.

In Note 22 Cash and Cash Equivalents (page 195), the balance for 2019 is presented as (932,167), indicating a negative value. However, the Consolidated Balance Sheet (page 146) and Cash Flow Statement (page 151) show this as a positive asset balance.

On the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (page 143), the 2019 column header is labeled 'HK$ 000', whereas all other statements and the 2018 comparative column use 'US$ 000'. The values in the 2019 column are inconsistent with a report denominated in US dollars.
Statement of Cash Flows (p. 150) reports 'Net cash generated from operations' of 327,617 while Note 31(a) (p. 211) reports it as 317,102.

The Consolidated Balance Sheet for 2019 lists 'Intangible assets' as US$2,373,252,000 (page 146 / pdf page 24). However, the detailed movement schedule in Note 11 (page 184 / pdf page 28) shows a closing net book amount of US$2,298,948,000. This is a discrepancy of US$74,304,000.

The 'Total Non-current assets' for 2019 on the Consolidated Balance Sheet is printed as US$2,940,021,000 (page 146 / pdf page 24). However, summing the printed components (2,373,252 + 195,876 + 383,802 + 15 + 6,274 + 2,737 + 25,421 + 26,948) results in US$3,014,325,000. The subtotal is correctly tied back to Note 3 if the Note 11 closing balance of 2,298,948 is used, confirming the line item value for Intangible Assets is likely the typo.

In Note 8 'Dividends' (page 181 / pdf page 67), the interim dividend is listed as US$15,962,000, but the total for the year is listed as US$10,962,000. Summing the components (15,962 + 0) should equal 15,962. Furthermore, the Consolidated Statement of Changes in Equity (page 148 / pdf page 65) shows the interim dividend paid as US$10,962,000, suggesting 15,962 is a typo.

In Note 4 'Operating Profit' (page 180 / pdf page 184), the total remuneration to auditors for 2019 is shown as '(4,511)' in brackets, which implies a credit to the profit and loss account. In contrast, the 2018 value is shown as '6,670' without brackets. Since these are expenses charged to the account as stated in the row header, the use of brackets is inconsistent with standard presentation of charges.

In Note 30 'Deferred Taxation' (page 209 / pdf page 92), the rollforward for 2019 begins with an opening balance of 'At 1 January' of US$(13,591) thousand. However, the closing balance 'At 31 December' for 2018 (Restated) on the same page is US$(13,951) thousand. These two values should match. This discrepancy of US$360,000 also affects the mathematical footing of the 2019 rollforward column (results in 24,953 instead of 24,593).
Intangible Assets on the Consolidated Balance Sheet (USD 2,373,252 thousand) does not tie to the closing balance in Note 11 (USD 2,298,948 thousand) or the Ten-Year Summary (USD 2,298,948 thousand).

Total non-current assets subtotal on the Consolidated Balance Sheet (USD 2,940,021 thousand) does not equal the sum of its components as printed (2,373,252 + 195,876 + 383,802 + 15 + 6,274 + 2,737 + 25,421 + 26,948 = 3,014,325). The subtotal only foots if the expected value from Note 11 (2,298,948) is used instead of the printed value (2,373,252).

Turnover on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (USD 11,601,937 thousand) does not tie to the total turnover reported in Note 3 (USD 11,413,312 thousand) or the Ten-Year Summary (USD 11,413,312 thousand).

Total Margin on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (USD 1,219,336 thousand) does not equal the sum of its components Gross Profit (1,241,591) and Other Income (27,745), which total 1,269,336. Total Margin (1,219,336) is correctly used in subsequent math for Operating Profit.

The Shareholders' funds attributable subtotal (USD 1,264,206 thousand) does not equal the sum of its components as printed: Share Capital (13,686) and Reserves (1,170,520) sum to 1,184,206. The Reserves figure should likely be 1,250,520 to correctly total the subtotal.
Net cash outflow from operating activities (USD 280,854 thousand) does not equal the sum of its components: Net cash generated (327,617) - HK tax (1,129) - Overseas tax (35,119) = 291,369.
'Net cash generated from operations' reported in Note 31(a) (USD 317,102 thousand) does not tie to the amount on the face of the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement (USD 327,617 thousand).
The rollforward for net deferred tax in Note 30 does not foot. At 1 Jan (-13,591) + PL charge (-11,184) + OCI (558) + Hedging (-1,007) + FX (631) = -24,593. The printed closing balance is -24,953.

The 2019 column header for the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account incorrectly labels the figures as 'HK$000', while the consistent reporting currency throughout the financial statements is 'US$000'. The subsequent 2018 column is correctly labeled as 'US$000'.

On page 2, the '2019 Operating Costs Breakdown by Segments' chart shows components SCS (443), LFL (328), and Onshore (220) which sum to US$991 million. However, the 'Operating Costs' chart directly above it and the accompanying text both state the total operating costs are US$992 million. (443 + 328 + 220 = 991).

On page 9, the table 'Consolidated Balance Sheet' showing the impacts of the adoption of HKFRS 16 is titled 'As at 1 January 2019'. However, the values in the 'Restated' column (e.g., PPE US$187,943k, ROU Assets US$421,027k, Reserves US$1,721,106k) match the opening balances for 1 January 2018 as shown in the restated comparative columns on the main Balance Sheet (page 212) and Note 13 (page 135). The values as at 1 January 2019 should match the 31 December 2018 balances (e.g., ROU Assets US$391,970k).

In Note 22 'Cash and Cash Equivalents' on page 49, the 2019 balance is shown as '(932,167)' in brackets. As this is an asset balance and other statements (e.g. Note 31 on page 131) confirm it is a positive cash position of US$932,167k, the use of brackets (typically representing a credit balance or deduction) is an error in presentation.

In Note 8 'Dividends' on page 150, the 2019 column lists the Interim dividend as 15,962, but the column total is shown as 10,962. Based on the 2019 share count (~8.5 billion) and the dividend per share (1 HK cent), the correct figure is approximately US$10,962k, making the 15,962 entry a typo and a cross-footing error.

Summary table for net deferred tax assets/liabilities shows an opening balance at 1 January 2019 of (13,591), but the closing balance from 31 December 2018 (restated) in the adjacent column is (13,951). Components on page 13 and 245 sum to (13,951), which is the necessary starting point for the 2019 rollforward calculations.

The Consolidated Cash Flow Statement line 'Net cash generated from operations' for 2019 is reported as 327,617, which does not tie to Note 31(a) on page 224 which reports 317,102. The subtotal 'Net cash outflow from operating activities' of 280,854 on page 24 correctly uses the 317,102 figure from the note (317,102 - 1,129 - 35,119 = 280,854).

The breakdown of 'Cash and cash equivalents at 1 January' for 2019 shows 612,931 for Continuing Operations and '-' for Discontinued, but the total for the row is reported as 612,391. The total matches the 31 December 2018 Balance Sheet, implying 612,931 is a typo for 612,391.

The Consolidated Balance Sheet reports Intangible assets of 2,373,252 for 2019, but Note 11 on page 146 summarizes components (Goodwill and others) to a total net book amount of 2,298,948. The Ten-Year Financial Summary on page 245 correctly uses the figure from the note (2,298,948).

Note 38(a)(III) states that a 0.1% change in 'variable interest rates on the bank borrowings' would affect profit by US$869,000, which implies variable rate debt of US$869 million. However, Note 24 on page 143 shows total bank borrowings (long and short term) are only US$304,906,000, rendering the sensitivity figure of 869,000 impossible for bank borrowings alone.
Turnover for 2019 on doc page 143 is US$11,601,937 (labeled HK$000), but Note 3 on doc page 175 and the Ten-Year Summary on doc page 244 show US$11,413,312.

Gross loss for 2019 on doc page 143 is reported as 1,241,591 and mislabeled as 'loss'. Based on Turnover of 11,413,312 (per Note 3) and Cost of Sales of 10,221,721, the Gross Profit should be 1,191,591. Even using the incorrect Turnover printed on the page (11,601,937), the math 11,601,937 - 10,221,721 = 1,380,216 does not result in the printed 1,241,591.
The 2019 column header on doc page 143 incorrectly states 'HK$000', while all other primary financial statements and notes (and the 2018 comparative column) use US$'000.
Intangible assets for 2019 on the Balance Sheet (doc page 146) is reported as 2,373,252, but Note 11 (doc page 184) and the Ten-Year Summary (doc page 245) show a balance of 2,298,948.

Reserves for 2019 on the Balance Sheet (doc page 147) is reported as 1,170,520. However, the subtotal 'Shareholders' funds attributable to the Company's Shareholders' is 1,264,206 and Share Capital is 13,686. Subtracting Share Capital from the subtotal gives expected reserves of 1,250,520. This expected value also matches the sum of Share Premium, Other Reserves, and Retained Earnings from the SOCE (760,754 + 46,184 + 443,582 = 1,250,520).

The Retained Earnings column closing balance for 2019 on doc page 148 is 443,582. Summing the column components (Opening 390,991 + Profit 16,748 + OCI item 901 - Transfer 577 - Disposal 659 - Acq NCI 2,513 + Partial disposal 94,402 - Dividends 54,810) results in 444,483. The printed total and intermediate 'Total comprehensive income' subtotal (16,748) appear to exclude the 901 OCI item printed in the column.

In Note 3 (doc page 177), the turnover for Supply Chain Solutions is reported as 88,344,820 (HK$000 column). However, the segment total shown is 9,999,701 (likely US$'000). Adding 88,344,820 to the other components does not equal the total. If SCS turnover was 8,834,482, the sum (8,834,482 + 1,173,277 - 8,058) would correctly equal 9,999,701.

In Note 4 (doc page 180), the 'Total remuneration to auditors' for 2019 is shown in brackets as (4,511), despite being a positive expense breakdown, whereas the 2018 figure is shown as a positive 6,670.

Trade amount due from other related companies (trade) has a closing balance of US$539,876,000 on page 191, but the aging table on page 192 for the same item sums to US$545,669,000 (US$256,330,000 + US$147,946,000 + US$141,393,000).
Intangible assets value on the Consolidated Balance Sheet is US$2,373,252,000, which does not tie to the closing net book amount of US$2,298,948,000 in Note 11 (page 184).

On the Consolidated Balance Sheet, Share capital (US$13,686,000) added to Reserves (US$1,170,520,000) equals US$1,184,206,000, but the subtotal for 'Shareholders’ funds attributable to the Company’s Shareholders' is incorrectly shown as US$1,264,206,000. US$1,264,206,000 is the correct total from the Statement of Changes in Equity, implying the Reserves line item (US$1,170,520,000) is incorrect and should be US$1,250,520,000.

Turnover on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account for 2019 is US$11,601,937,000, which does not tie to Note 3 (page 175 and 178) or the Summary of the Year (page 215), all of which list US$11,413,312,000.

In the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement, 'Net cash generated from operations' for 2019 is US$327,617,000, which does not tie to US$317,102,000 shown in Note 31(a) (page 211). Note 31(a) is internally consistent (417,535 + 49,233 + 157,621 - 307,287 = 317,102), making the value on the face of the statement incorrect.

In Note 8, the interim dividend paid in 2019 is US$15,962,000. However, the Consolidated Statement of Changes in Equity (page 148) and the Company Reserve Movement (page 230, Note 41a) both correctly show the amount as US$10,962,000. (Calculation: 8,538,926,906 shares * US$0.001 per share ≈ US$8.5M, but factoring 1 HK cent per share implies ~US$11M). US$15,962,000 appears to be a typo in Note 8.

In Note 22, the 2019 'Cash and bank balances' value of US$932,167,000 is shown in parentheses, which typically denotes a negative value or bank overdraft. However, on the Consolidated Balance Sheet (page 146), it is listed as a positive asset, and the Summary of the Year (page 215) also treats it as positive cash on hand.

In Note 3 (Supplementary analysis for Services segment), the column header for 2019 incorrectly indicates 'HK$·000', whereas the rest of the document, the 2018 comparative column, and the values themselves are in US$'000.

On the face of the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account for 2019 (page 143), the line item 'Total margin' (US$1,219,336,000) does not correctly sum its preceding components (Gross Profit of US$1,241,591,000 and Other Income of US$27,745,000). Summing these should result in US$1,269,336,000. Furthermore, Note 1.18 defines Total Margin as including Gross Profit and recurring income. US$1,219,336,000 matches the 'Total margin' reported in segment Note 3 (page 175), suggesting the Gross Profit line on page 143 is incorrect.

The line item for Intangible assets on the 2019 Consolidated Balance Sheet (page 48) is US$2,373,252, but Note 11 (page 102) shows a closing net book amount of US$2,298,948. The Ten-Year Financial Summary (page 19) also confirms US$2,298,948. Furthermore, the Balance Sheet total of US$2,940,021 only checks out if the correct value of US$2,298,948 is used.

The 'Reserves' line item on the 2019 Consolidated Balance Sheet (page 183) is US$1,170,520. However, the sum of its components from the Statement of Changes in Equity (page 231) — Share premium (US$760,754), Other reserves (US$46,184), and Retained earnings (US$443,582) — equals US$1,250,520. Additionally, the printed value of US$1,170,520 fails to cross-foot with 'Share capital' (US$13,686) to the subtotal 'Shareholders\' funds' (US$1,264,206).

The Note 1.1(A) table 'Consolidated Balance Sheet' on page 90 is titled 'As at 1 January 2019', but the values (e.g., PPE US$187,943, Cash US$348,940) correspond to the restated balances as at 1 January 2018 (as shown on page 48). No separate impact for 1 January 2019 is shown, implying a simple year-label error.

In Note 30 (page 124), the 'Movements in the net deferred tax (assets)/liabilities' table shows an opening balance for 2019 of US$(13,591). However, the restated closing balance for 2018 in the adjacent column is US$(13,951). These two must match. Note 1.1(A) confirms the 31 Dec 2018 / 1 Jan 2019 net position is indeed US$(13,951).

Note 8 (page 128) reports 2019 Interim dividends paid of US$15,962,000. This conflicts with the Consolidated Statement of Changes in Equity (page 231) and the Report of the Directors (page 157), which both correctly record US$10,962,000.

In Note 3 (page 101), the turnover for the Supply Chain Solutions segment is reported as 88,344,820. This is ten times the figure of 8,834,482 reported in the performance review (page 100) and Note 3 (page 178). It also causes the segment subtotal (9,999,701) to not cross-foot (88,344,820 + 1,173,277 - 8,058 != 9,999,701). Additionally, the column is incorrectly labeled HK$000 while the report is in US$.
Turnover for 2019 on page 2 is US$11,601,937, which does not tie to Note 3 on page 39, which reports US$11,413,312. Page 83 and 234 also confirm US$11,413 million.

The reported Gross Margin (labeled Gross loss) for 2019 is US$1,241,591. Based on the Cost of sales of US$10,221,721 and the Note 3 Turnover of US$11,413,312, it should be US$1,191,591. Even using the turnover on this page (US$11,601,937), the math would be US$1,380,216.
Total margin for 2019 is calculated as US$1,241,591 (Gross loss) + US$27,745 (Other income) = US$1,269,336. The table shows US$1,219,336. This is a discrepancy of US$50,000.

In Note 8, the total dividend for 2019 is reported as US$10,962,000. However, the only component listed is Interim dividend of US$15,962,000. The total should be the sum of components (15,962 + 0 = 15,962). Note that the US$10,962,000 appears to be the correct value based on other note ties.

In the Analysis of balances of cash and cash equivalents, the total at 1 January 2019 is reported as US$612,391. However, the sum of its components (Continuing Operations US$612,931 and Discontinued Operations nil) is US$612,931.
The net deferred tax asset (rollforward start) at 1 January 2019 is reported as US$13,591,000. However, the closing balance at 31 December 2018 was US$13,951,000. These values should match.
Net cash generated from operations for 2019 in Note 31(a) is reported as US$317,102,000. However, the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement on page 219 reports US$327,617,000 for this same item.

In Note 3 (Services segment breakdown), SCS turnover is reported as US$88,344,820. The total turnover for the segment is US$9,999,701. Adding the components (88,344,820 + 1,173,277 - 8,058) results in US$89,510,039. The SCS turnover is likely a typo for US$8,834,482.

The 2019 cash and bank balance is shown in brackets as (932,167), implying a negative value or liability, whereas it is a positive asset of US$932,167 on the Balance Sheet. The 2018 comparative in the same table is shown as a positive 612,391.
Subtotal 'Wholly repayable within 5 years' for 2019 is reported as US$1,538,851,000. Sum of components (516,798 + 314,079 + 732,974) equals US$1,563,851,000.

The primary header for the top section of the Profit and Loss Account is labeled "Discontinued Operations" instead of "Continuing Operations". The 2018 turnover of 12,700,744 corresponds to Continuing Operations.

The note heading on page 24 is "21 Trade and Other Payables", but the table content and corresponding Note 21 content on other pages (e.g. page 243) refers to Trade and Other Receivables. Note 23 is for Payables.

Turnover for 2019 in the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (US$11,601,937 thousand) does not tie to Note 3 Segment Information (US$11,413,312 thousand). The P&L amount is overstated by US$188,625 thousand.

On the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account, Turnover (11,601,937) minus Cost of Sales (10,221,721) plus Other Income (27,745) equals 1,407,961, but the reported Total Margin is 1,219,336. Note that using the correct Turnover from Note 3 (11,413,312) resolves this check: 11,413,312 - 10,221,721 + 27,745 = 1,219,336.

In Note 3 Segment Information (supplementary analysis for Services segment), the 2019 column is incorrectly labeled as 'HK$000' in the header. Based on comparison with the 2018 column (US$000) and other financial data, the values are in US$000.

In Note 3 (supplementary analysis for Services segment), Turnover for Supply Chain Solutions is reported as 88,344,820. Based on the consolidated total and segment summaries (e.g., page 23), this appears to be a typo adding an extra zero, and should likely be 8,834,482.

In Note 3 (supplementary analysis for Services segment), the subtotal for 2019 Turnover (9,999,701) does not equal the sum of its components (88,344,820 + 1,173,277 - 8,058 = 89,510,039). This is driven by the typo in the Suppy Chain Solutions turnover amount.

In Note 28 Long-term Liabilities, the 'Within 1 year' maturity for 2019 is reported as 516,798. However, the components of current long-term liabilities (Current portion of long-term notes 374,361 + Current portion of lease liabilities 117,437) sum to 491,798. This discrepancy of 25,000 causes further footing errors on the page.

In Note 28 Long-term Liabilities, the subtotal 'Wholly repayable within 5 years' (1,538,851) does not equal the sum of its components as shown in the table (516,798 + 314,079 + 732,974 = 1,563,851). Given the total column, the Within 1yr component is the likely source of the error.
'Net cash generated from operations' for 2019 in the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement (US$327,617 thousand) does not tie to the reconciliation in Note 31(a) (US$317,102 thousand).

In the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement, 'Net cash generated from operations' (327,617) minus Hong Kong profit tax (1,129) minus Overseas taxation (35,119) equals 291,369, but the reported subtotal 'Net cash outflow [sic] from operating activities' is 280,854. This mismatch (10,515) aligns with the tie error for the 'Net cash generated' line.

In Note 22 Cash and Cash Equivalents, the 2019 balance for 'Cash and bank balances' is erroneously displayed in parentheses as (932,167), implying a negative value, which contradicts its presentation as a positive asset in the Consolidated Balance Sheet.
Turnover on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (page 143) is US$11,601,937, but Note 3 (page 194) and the Results Summary (page 13) both show US$11,413,312.

On the P&L (page 143), Gross [Profit/Loss] is US$1,241,591, but calculated from Turnover (11,601,937) minus Cost of Sales (10,221,721) it should be US$1,380,216. Even using external turnover from Note 3 (11,413,312) minus Cost of Sales per Note 4 (10,221,721) yields US$1,191,591.

The Consolidated Balance Sheet (page 146) lists Intangible Assets as US$2,373,252, but Note 11 (page 251) and the Ten-Year Summary (page 245) both show US$2,298,948. Summing the non-current asset components on the Balance Sheet using the Note 11 value (2,298,948) correctly matches the reported subtotal of US$2,940,021.
Note 31(a) (page 211) reconciles Profit Before Taxation to 'Net cash generated from operations' of US$317,102, but the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement (page 150) reports US$327,617.

On the Cash Flow Statement (page 150), 'Net cash outflow from operating activities' is US$280,854. However, summing its components (Net cash generated 327,617 - HK tax paid 1,129 - Overseas tax paid 35,119) yields US$291,369. Conversely, using the reconciliation total from Note 31(a) (317,102 - 1,129 - 35,119) yields US$280,854, confirming the statement values are internally inconsistent.

In Note 8 Dividends (page 181), the interim dividend row lists US$15,962 while the total line for 2019 at the bottom of the table correctly shows US$10,962, which is consistent with the Statement of Changes in Equity (page 148).

The summary rollforward for net deferred tax assets/liabilities in Note 30 (page 209) does not add up. Summing the listed rows (Opening -13,591 + P&L credit -11,184 + OCI credit 558 + Hedge charge -1,007 + Exch 631) equals -24,593, but the reported closing balance is -24,953. Comparison with the components tables on pages 209/154 suggests the opening balance row should have been 13,951 (from the restated 2018 Balance Sheet) and exchange differences should have been (631).

The Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (page 143) has a column header '2019 HK$000', while the entire rest of the financial statements and the 2018 comparative column use US dollars (US$'000). The values shown are clearly intended to be US dollars.
The Consolidated Profit and Loss Account header states 'For the year ended 31 December 2018' but the report contains results for the year 2019.
Turnover on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (11,601,937) does not tie to the sum of segments in Note 3 (11,413,312).
Gross loss (should be Gross Profit) on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account does not equal Turnover less Cost of Sales (11,601,937 - 10,221,721 = 1,380,216).
Total margin on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (1,219,336) does not equal Gross loss plus Other income (1,241,591 + 27,745 = 1,269,336).
Intangible assets on the Consolidated Balance Sheet (2,373,252) does not tie to the closing balance in Note 11 (2,298,948).

Sum of non-current asset components on the face of the Consolidated Balance Sheet (2,373,252 + 195,876 + 383,802 + 15 + 6,274 + 2,737 + 25,421 + 26,948 = 3,014,325) does not equal the reported total of 2,940,021.
Reserves on the face of the Consolidated Balance Sheet (1,170,520) does not tie to the sum of components in Note 26 movements (SP 760,754 + Other 46,184 + RE 443,582 = 1,250,520).
Shareholders' funds subtotal on the face of the Consolidated Balance Sheet (1,264,206) does not equal the sum of Share capital and Reserves (13,686 + 1,170,520 = 1,184,206).
Net cash generated from operations in Note 31(a) (317,102) does not tie to the value on the face of the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement (327,617).
Interim dividend per Note 8 (15,962 US$'000) does not tie to the value disclosed in the Report of the Directors text (US$11 million).
Note 8 Dividends: Total dividend for 2019 is shown as 10,962, but the only component is the Interim dividend of 15,962 (and nil final). 15,962 + 0 should equal 15,962.

Note 28 Long-term Liabilities: The subtotal 'Wholly repayable within 5 years' for 2019 is shown as 1,538,851. However, the sum of its components (Within 1 year: 516,798; Between 1 and 2 years: 314,079; Between 2 and 5 years: 732,974) is 1,563,851.

On page 150, the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement, the 'Net cash generated from operations' of 327,617 less Hong Kong profits tax paid (1,129) and overseas taxation paid (35,119) should result in a subtotal of 291,369. However, the reported 'Net cash outflow from operating activities' is US$280,854,000. Reconciliation in Note 31(a) on page 211 confirms the correct value for operating cash generation is US$317,102,000 (317,102 - 1,129 - 35,119 = 280,854).

On page 146, the Consolidated Balance Sheet shows US$2,373,252,000 for Non-current 'Intangible assets'. However, Note 11 'Intangible Assets' on page 184 states the closing net book amount as US$2,298,948,000. Re-calculating the non-current asset subtotal on page 146 (reported as 2,940,021) using the other listed components indicates that US$2,298,948,000 is the mathematically correct value.
On page 146, the section of the Consolidated Balance Sheet listing non-current assets (Intangible assets, PPE, etc.) is incorrectly labeled with the header 'Non-current liabilities'.

In Note 8 'Dividends' on page 181, the interim dividend paid is reported as US$15,962,000. With a proposed final dividend of Nil, the reported total of US$10,962,000 is mathematically inconsistent (15,962 + 0 != 10,962). The Reserve Movement table on page 230 confirms the interim dividend was US$10,962,000.

Note 21 on page 192 is incorrectly titled 'Trade and Other Payables'. The contents of the note (Trade and bills receivable - net, other receivables, and aging analysis of debtors) clearly indicate it pertains to Trade and Other Receivables, tying to the asset side of the Consolidated Balance Sheet.

In Note 28 'Long-term Liabilities' on page 204, the maturity analysis components for 2019 (within 1 year: 516,798; between 1-2 years: 314,079; between 2-5 years: 732,974) sum to US$1,563,851,000. However, the reported subtotal for liabilities 'Wholly repayable within 5 years' is US$1,538,851,000.

In the maturity analysis for liquidity risk in Note 38(c) on page 224, the amount for 'Long-term notes - unsecured' due in 'Less than 1 year' is US$405,870,000. This contradicts the 'Current portion of long-term notes' reported in Note 28 on page 203, which is US$374,361,000.

The title of the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account incorrectly states 'For the year ended 31 December 2018'. Since this is the 2019 Annual Report and the statement includes 2019 data, the title should refer to 2019.

In the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account, 2019 Gross profit is reported as 1,241,591. However, subtracting reported Cost of sales (10,221,721) from Turnover (11,413,312) results in 1,191,591. Furthermore, adding reported Other income (27,745) to the calculated 1,191,591 correctly results in the reported Total margin of 1,219,336.

Consolidated Balance Sheet 2019 line item 'Intangible assets' is 2,373,252. The total sum of components in Note 11 (Intangible Assets) on page 184 is 2,298,948. The Balance Sheet's own non-current asset subtotal calculation (2,940,021) only foots if the correct Note 11 value of 2,298,948 is used instead of the reported 2,373,252.

On the Consolidated Balance Sheet (continued), the sum of reported 'Share capital' (13,686) and 'Reserves' (1,170,520) is 1,184,206, which does not equal the reported subtotal 'Shareholders' funds' of 1,264,206. Based on the components in the Statement of Changes in Equity (page 148), the correct Reserves value should be 1,250,520.

In the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement, the line 'Net cash generated from operations' for 2019 is reported as 327,617. This disagrees with the corresponding reconciliation in Note 31(a) on page 211, which shows a total of 317,102. The statement's final operating cash flow value (280,854) effectively uses the correct note value (317,102 - 1,129 - 35,119 = 280,854), identifying 327,617 as a typo.

In Note 30 (Deferred Taxation), the rollforward summary table reports the 1 January 2019 net deferred tax balance as (13,591). However, the sum of the restated 1 January 2019 assets (37,684 from p209) and liabilities (23,733 from p210) results in a net asset of 13,951. Additionally, the rollforward of -13,591 + reported changes does not foot correctly to the reported closing balance of (24,953), whereas an opening of -13,951 would.
Line item on Page 143 labeled 'Gross loss' contains a positive value of 1,241,591, which represents Gross Profit. This appears to be a labeling error.

Turnover on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (expressed in HK$000, but actually US$000 values) shows 11,601,937, which does not tie to the Segment Information (Note 3) on Page 175, which explicitly states Turnover of 11,413,312.

Gross Profit (mislabeled as 'Gross loss') on Page 143 is 1,241,591. Based on the turnover of 11,601,937 and cost of sales of 10,221,721 on the same page, the calculated value should be 1,380,216. Even using the correct turnover of 11,413,312 found elsewhere, the calculation would be 1,191,591.

Intangible assets on the Consolidated Balance Sheet (Page 176) are presented as 2,373,252. However, the Intangible Assets note (Note 11) on Page 166 shows a total closing net book amount of 2,298,948.

The 'Reserves' line on the Balance Sheet (Page 147) is 1,170,520. However, the Statement of Changes in Equity (Page 148) shows the sum of reserves components (Share premium 760,754 + Other reserves 46,184 + Retained earnings 443,582) to be 1,250,520. The line 'Shareholders' funds attributable to the Company's Shareholders' (1,264,206) is correct relative to the components, indicating the 'Reserves' line item itself is misstated.
'Net cash generated from operations' on the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement (Page 150) is 327,617. However, the reconciliation in Note 31(a) on Page 181 shows this value as 317,102.

Net cash outflow from operating activities on Page 150 is 280,854. Calculated from the provided components (Net cash from operations 327,617 - HK tax 1,129 - Overseas tax 35,119), the result should be 291,369. (Note: using the 317,102 value from Note 31a correctly results in 280,854, confirming the error is in the top line value).

In Note 28 (Long-term Liabilities) on Page 204, the subtotal 'Wholly repayable within 5 years' is 1,538,851. The sum of its components (Within 1 year 516,798 + Between 1-2 years 314,079 + Between 2-5 years 732,974) is 1,563,851.

In Note 3 (Segment Information) on Page 177, the 2019 column header incorrectly states 'HK$000', whereas the reporting currency for the rest of parameters like turnover (11.4M) is US$000. These values are in USD, not HKD.

The emolument bands table in Note 10(a) on Page 116 does not cover the remuneration of Executive Director Joseph C. Phi, which is stated as US$3,174,000 in Note 42(a) on Page 159. The highest band provided is US$1,986,000.

In the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement, the 'Net cash outflow from operating activities' subtotal for 2019 is shown as 280,854. However, subtracting the tax items from 'Net cash generated from operations' yields 327,617 - 1,129 - 35,119 = 291,369. This discrepancy of 10,515 is explained by an error in the 'Net cash generated from operations' line item (see Note 31(a) tie-in).

In the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement, the sum of the components for 'Net cash (outflow)/inflow from investing activities' for 2018 (Restated) is -71,793 - 34,134 + 1,100,000 - 55,073 - 42,889 + 2,377 + 6,992 + 10,608 + 1,416 - 129 = 917,375. The statement reports a subtotal of 877,375, a discrepancy of 40,000.

The line item 'Net cash generated from operations' for 2019 in the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement is 327,617. However, the reconciliation in Note 31(a) shows the total 'Net cash generated from operations' as 317,102. This is a discrepancy of 10,515. The subtotal on page 5 (280,854) is mathematically consistent with the Note 31(a) value (317,102 - 1,129 - 35,119 = 280,854), identifying 327,617 as the erroneous reported value.

In Note 30 'Deferred Taxation', the net deferred tax rollforward for 2019 does not cross-foot. At 1 January (13,591) + Charged to P&L (11,184) + Charged to OCI 558 + Charged to hedging (1,007) + Exchange 631 = -24,593. The table reports an ending balance of (24,953), a difference of 360.

In the Statement of Changes in Equity, the 'Total transactions with owners in their capacity as owners' subtotal for 2018 under the 'Other reserves' column is (501,243). The sum of the individual items listed in that column is -7,577 - 59 - 15,798 + 24,981 - 519,549 + 67,000 = -451,002. This represents a discrepancy of 50,241.

In Note 4 'Operating Profit from Continuing Operations', the 'Total remuneration to auditors' for 2019 is presented in brackets as (4,511), while the 2018 figure is positive 6,670. As these represent expenses (charges), the bracketed presentation for 2019 is inconsistent with the prior year and the surrounding 'Charging' items on page 137.

In Note 30 'Deferred Taxation' summary table, the balance at 1 January 2019 is reported as (13,591). However, the restated 2018 ending balances for DT assets (15,644 on page 120) and DT liabilities (1,693 on page 212) result in a net asset of 13,951. The discrepancy of 360 matches the error found in the rollforward calculation.
The column header for 2019 values is 'HK$000' while the rest of the report uses 'US$'. Page 143 and 212 correctly show 'US$'000' for 2018 in the same table.

Turnover for 2019 is reported as 11,601,937 on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (p143, p212), but is reported as 11,413,312 in the Ten-Year Financial Summary (p105) and Segment Information (Note 3, p182).
Reported Gross loss of 1,241,591 for 2019 does not cross-foot. Turnover (11,601,937) minus Cost of sales (10,221,721) equals 1,380,216.
Total margin of 1,219,336 for 2019 does not cross-foot from the lines above. Gross loss (1,241,591) plus Other income (27,745) equals 1,269,336.
The label 'Gross loss' is used for a positive value (Turnover less Cost of Sales). It should be labeled 'Gross profit'.

Balance Sheet 'Intangible assets' figure of 2,373,252 for 2019 does not tie to Note 11 (p140, p184) which shows a closing total of 2,298,948. Additionally, this BS overstated row prevents the column from cross-footing to its reported subtotal.
Balance Sheet 2019 non-current asset subtotal '2,940,021' does not equal the sum of the components above it (3,014,325). The discrepancy is due to the overstated Intangible Assets row.
The Consolidated Cash Flow Statement (p63) reports 'Net cash generated from operations' of 327,617 for 2019, but the corresponding reconciliation in Note 31(a) (p160) totals 317,102.

Note 8 (p156) reports 2019 interim dividend paid as 15,962, which contradicts the Consolidated Statement of Changes in Equity (p13) and Note 31(b) (p197) which show 10,962. The Report of the Directors (p50) confirms the amount was US$11 million.

In Note 28 Maturity Analysis (p232), the sum of individual rows (516,798 + 314,079 + 732,974) equals 1,563,851, but the subtotal reported for 'Wholly repayable within 5 years' is 1,538,851. The 'Within 1 year' component is overstated by 25,000 relative to the current portion disclosed elsewhere.

Note 30 (p75) Deferred Taxation rollforward summary starts with an opening balance of (13,591) for 2019, but the correctly restated closing balance for 2018 (as found in Note 30 detail tables on p75 and p104) is (13,951).
Note 1.1(A) on page 247 reports the HKFRS 16 impact on Reserves as at 1 January 2019 as (13,066). However, the same note on page 51 and the SOCE on page 13 report the impact as (14,597).

Note 22 (p195) shows the 2019 Cash and bank balance in brackets '(932,167)', implying a negative/credit balance, which is inconsistent with its presentation as a positive asset on the Balance Sheet (p146) and Cash Flow Statement (p44).

Turnover for 2019 on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (HK$11,601,937k) does not tie to Note 3 Total Turnover (US$11,413,312k). Additionally, the column is labeled as HK$000 whereas US$000 is used elsewhere.

On the P&L, Gross loss (stated as 1,241,591) does not equal Turnover (11,601,937) minus Cost of sales (10,221,721), which is 1,380,216. Also, the label 'Gross loss' is inappropriate for a positive value.
On the P&L, Total margin (1,219,336) does not equal Gross profit/loss (1,241,591) plus Other income (27,745), which is 1,269,336.

Intangible assets on the Consolidated Balance Sheet (2,373,252) does not tie to Note 11 (2,298,948). The reported subtotal for Non-current assets (2,940,021) only foots if the lower Note 11 value is used.
Net cash outflow from operating activities (280,854) does not equal the sum of its stated components (327,617 - 1,129 - 35,119 = 291,369).
'Net cash generated from operations' on the CF statement (327,617) does not tie to the Note 31(a) reconciliation (317,102). Using the Note 31(a) value makes the CF operating subtotal foot correctly.
In Note 3, turnover for the Supply Chain Solutions business is recorded as 88,344,820, which is inconsistent with the total Service segment turnover of 9,999,701. It is likely a typo for 8,834,482.
In Note 3, the turnover component 'Sales of goods of SCS business' for 2018 (9,916,489) does not tie to the Supply Chain Solutions Business Results table on page 215 (9,933,000 or US$9,933M).

In Note 30 Deferred Taxation rollforward, the 'Exchange differences' of 631 results in a math error. Re-summing individual asset and liability exchange moves results in a net negative impact of (631). Correcting the sign makes the note summary foot to the ending balance.
In Note 28 maturity table, the subtotal 'Wholly repayable within 5 years' (1,538,851) does not equal the sum of its components (516,798 + 314,079 + 732,974 = 1,563,851).

In Note 19(a), the sum of the ageing categories for trade amounts due from related companies (256,330 + 147,946 + 141,393 = 545,669) does not tie to Note 19's total trade line item (539,933) on page 191.

In the Consolidated Statement of Changes in Equity, the 2018 Retained Earnings closing balance (390,991) does not foot from its opening balance and movements (483,996 op - 13,308 profit - 21,830 div - 519,549 div - 32,886 div - 24,981 transfer = -128,558). Furthermore, the transaction with owners subtotal (-565,083) is stated incorrectly as it sums to -599,246.

Intangible assets on Balance Sheet (page 146) is US$2,373,252,000, but Note 11 (page 227) shows a total of US$2,298,948,000. The non-current assets subtotal on the Balance Sheet (US$2,940,021,000) only cross-foots correctly if the US$2,298,948,000 figure from the note is used.

Turnover for 2019 on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (page 143) is US$11,601,937,000, which does not match the US$11,413,312,000 shown in Note 3 (page 215) and the 'Summary of the Year' (page 6).

On the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (page 143), Gross Profit (mislabeled as Gross Loss) of US$1,241,591,000 does not equal Turnover (US$11,601,937,000) minus Cost of Sales (US$10,221,721,000), which results in US$1,380,216,000. Furthermore, adding Other Income (US$27,745,000) to the shown Gross Profit should equal the Total Margin (US$1,219,336,000), but creates a US$50,000,000 discrepancy.

In Note 28 (page 204), the subtotal for financial liabilities 'Wholly repayable within 5 years' is US$1,538,851,000, but the sum of the components (Within 1 year: 516,798; Between 1 and 2 years: 314,079; Between 2 and 5 years: 732,974) is US$1,563,851,000.

In Note 30 (page 209) top table, the movement in net deferred tax assets does not cross-foot manually. The sum of parts (-13,591 - 11,184 + 558 - 1,007 + 631) is -24,593, while the reported total is -24,953. Additionally, the opening balance at 1 January 2019 of (13,591) mismatches the restated 31 December 2018 net asset balance of 13,951 calculated from the detailed asset and liability components in the lower tables.

On the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement (page 150), 'Net cash generated from operations' is US$327,617,000, mismatching Note 31(a) (page 211) which shows US$317,102,000. The subtotal for 'Net cash outflow from operating activities' (US$280,854,000) is only mathematically correct if the Note 31(a) value of US$317,102,000 is utilized.

In Note 8 Dividends (page 120), the interim dividend for 2019 is incorrectly listed as US$15,962,000, while the year total is shown as US$10,962,000 (which correctly sums if the interim value was 10,962). The 15,962 figure is a typo for 10,962.

On the Consolidated Balance Sheet (page 147), the subtotal 'Shareholders’ funds attributable to the Company’s Shareholders' of US$1,264,206,000 does not equal the sum of its components: Share capital (US$13,686,000) and Reserves (US$1,170,520,000), which sum to US$1,184,206,000.
On the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (page 143), the row representing Gross Profit is incorrectly labeled as 'Gross loss' for both 2019 and 2018, despite representing positive profit margins.
